Alias: F equals m a, Force equals mass times acceleration
QuestionTexts: M:It takes &F N to accelerate a ball &A m/s/s. What is its mass?#A:A force of &F N is applied on a ball of &M kg mass. What is its acceleration?# F:Krishin pushes a barrel of &M kg mass and accelerates it &A m/s/s down the stairs. What is the force necessary?

Alias: A equals V squared divided by R, equation for centripetal acceleration, centripetal acceleration in terms of velocity and radius
QuestionTexts: A:What is the centripetal acceleration necessary to keep a planet moving at a linear velocity of &V m/s perfectly in a &R m orbit?#V:It takes &A m/s/s of centripetal acceleration to keep a planet in orbit &R meters away from the sun. What is its linear velocity?#R:It takes &A m/s/s of centripetal acceleration to keep a planet going &V meters per second in orbit around the sun. How far is it from the sun?

Alias: potential energy equation, gravitational potential energy in terms of mass and change in height
QuestionTexts: U:Assuming a gravitational constant of 10, what is the gravitational potential energy of a &M kg mass lifted &H meters off of the ground?#M:Assuming a gravitational constant of 10, what is the mass of an object with &U joules of gravitational potential energy at a height of &H meters?#H:Assuming a gravitational constant of 10, a gravitational potential energy of &U joules, and a mass of &M, what must the height be?

Alias: kinetic energy in terms of mass and velocity"
QuestionTexts: K:What is the kinetic energy of an object with &M kg mass moving at &V m/s?#M:An object has &K Joules of kinetic energy and is moving at a velocity of &V m/s. What must its mass be?#V:How fast would an object of &M kg have to go in order to have a kinetic energy of &K Joules?

Alias: impulse equation, impulse if given constant force and time
QuestionTexts: J:What is the impulse given by a constant force of &F N applied for &T seconds?#T:How long would a constant force of &F N have to be applied for to have an impulse of &J N s?#F:What would have to be the magnitude of a constant force if it is applied for &T seconds and results in an impulse of &J n s?

Alias: pivnert, p v equals n r t, ideal gas law, general gas equation
QuestionTexts: P:&MOL mols of CO2 are heated to &T K confined in a &VO L volume. How much pressure does it exert?#VO:&P N of pressure is created by heating &MOL mols of matter to &T K in a rigid container. What must its volume be?#MOL: How many mols at a temperature of &T K in a container of &VO L must be in it to exert a pressure of &P N?#T:What is the temperature in Kelvin needed for &MOL mols of matter in a &VO L rigid container to exert a pressure of &P N?

Alias: money multiplier equation, money multiplier is inverse of R
QuestionTexts: MM:What is the money multiplier if the reserve requirement is &RE?#RE:What is the reserve requirement if the money multiplier is &MM?

MS: If real output is $&Y, the price level is &PL, and the velocity of money is &VM, what is the money supply?#VM: If the money supply is $&MS, the price level is &PL, and real output is &Y, what is the velocity of money?#PL:If the money supply is $&MS, real output is &Y, and the velocity of money is &VM,  what must the price level be?#Y:If the money supply is $&MS, the price level is &PL, and the velocity of money is &VM, what is the real output of the economy?
